node.title: COVID-19 world latest: Omicron cases doubling every 2 days in UK, US deaths up 40 percent in 2 weeks
node.description: Here's the latest on the pandemic from around the world overnight.
node.content: ["Here's the latest on the pandemic from around the world overnight.", "US", "The Omicron variant is estimated to be 2.9 percent of the COVID-19 variants circulating in the United States, up from just 0.4 percent a week earlier. It's even more common in New York - 13.1 percent.\u00a0", "The seven-day moving average of daily new cases increased 37.3 percent. Death rates and hospitalisations are also moving up - the average deaths per day sits at 1276, up 40 percent in the past two weeks.\u00a0", "A divided US appeals court has rebuffed a request by six employees to block United Airlines from enforcing a COVID-19 vaccine mandate for workers that imposes unpaid leave on those who are granted religious or medical exceptions.", "The NFL sent a memo to teams on Monday requiring their staff members to receive a vaccine booster amid a COVID-19 outbreak that saw 36 players test positive.", "Apple said on Tuesday it would require all customers and employees to wear masks at its US retail stores amid a surge in COVID-19 cases.", "Africa is experiencing its fastest surge in COVID-19 cases this year, with the number up 83 percent in the past week. The number of new COVID-19 cases on the continent is currently doubling every five days, the shortest time frame reported this year.", "As of Monday, only 20 African countries had vaccinated at least 10 percent of their population, according to the WHO. Some countries, like Democratic Republic of Congo and Chad, have vaccinated less than 1 percent.", "South Africa", "Pfizer-BioNTech's COVID-19 vaccine has been less effective in South Africa at keeping people infected with the virus out of hospital since the Omicron variant emerged last month, a real-world study published on Tuesday showed.", "France", "France reported another 158 deaths.\u00a0", "Italy", "Italy reported 120 deaths and 20,677 new cases.", "UK", "British Prime Minister Boris Johnson faces a large rebellion among his Conservative lawmakers on Tuesday in a Parliamentary vote over new restrictions to try to curb the spread of the Omicron variant.", "British Deputy Prime Minister Dominic Raab said on Tuesday that there were 10 people in hospital with Omicron.", "Britain reported 59,610 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, the highest figure since early January, as it faces what Prime Minister Boris Johnson has called a \"tidal wave\" on infections from the Omicron variant, official data showed. The figures also showed there had been 150 deaths within 28 days of a positive test.", "The British government will remove all 11 countries from its COVID-19 travel red list from Wednesday because there is now community transmission of Omicron in Britain, Health Secretary Sajid Javid told Parliament.", "The Omicron variant of the novel coronavirus is showing a higher rate of reinfection that other variants and its growth rate is shortening in the United Kingdom, the Health Security Agency's chief medical adviser said on Tuesday - doubling every two days.", "Singapore", "Singapore is considering requiring its residents to get a booster shot to qualify as fully vaccinated against COVID-19, its health minister said on Tuesday, as it seeks to protect its population from the Omicron variant.", "Singapore reported 339 new coronavirus cases on Monday, the fewest since early September. It has so far recorded 16 Omicron variant cases, all but two of which were imported.", "India", "India is struggling to export its surplus of COVID-19 vaccines as logistical hurdles delay their use in many countries despite low levels of inoculation.", "Indonesia", "Indonesia started vaccinating elementary school children aged six-11 against COVID-19 on Tuesday, becoming one of the few countries in Asia to start mass inoculations for young children.", "COVID-19 infections are more likely to trigger rare cardiovascular complications such as heart inflammation and irregular heartbeat than vaccines, a British study showed on Tuesday, after scientists parsed data of about 38 million vaccinated people.", "German researchers have found that COVID-19 therapies developed by Eli Lilly and Regeneron lose most of their effectiveness when exposed in laboratory tests to the Omicron variant.", "Pfizer on Tuesday said final analysis of its antiviral COVID-19 pill still showed near 90 percent efficacy in preventing hospitalisations and deaths in high-risk patients, and recent lab data suggests the drug retains its effectiveness against the fast spreading Omicron variant of the coronavirus.", "Pfizer-BioNTech's COVID-19 vaccine has been less effective in South Africa at keeping people infected with the virus out of hospital since the Omicron variant emerged last month, a real-world study published on Tuesday showed.", "Vaccine booster shots can play a role in curbing the spread of COVID-19 as long as people most in need of protection also get access to jabs, the head of the World Health Organization said on Tuesday.", "A global study found while two in five COVID-19 cases are asymptomatic, just 0.25 percent of those testing positive lacked symptoms, \"reflecting the targeting of tests to those with signs of illness\".\u00a0", "Reuters / Newshub."]
